title: MLflow is not working after latest release 2.0.0
body:
### System information

- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: MacOS
- **MLflow installed from (source or binary)**: source
- **MLflow version (run ``mlflow --version``)**: 1.28.0
- **Python version**: 3.7


### Code to reproduce issue

python3 setup.py sdist bdist_wheel
pip3 install mlflow-1.28.0.dev0-py3-none-any.whl
mlflow --version
import mlflow

### Describe the problem

I wanted to use old version of mlflow but after latest release whenever I am trying to build wheel file using below command

**python3 setup.py sdist bdist_wheel**

and then installing using

**pip3 install mlflow-1.28.0.dev0-py3-none-any.whl**

then running

**mlflow --version**
or
**import mlflow**

getting below error

> Traceback (most recent call last):
>   File "/opt/conda/miniconda3/bin/mlflow", line 5, in <module>
>     from mlflow.cli import cli
>   File "/opt/conda/miniconda3/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/__init__.py", line 47, in <module>
>     import mlflow.pipelines
>   File "/opt/conda/miniconda3/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/pipelines/__init__.py", line 32, in <module>
>     from mlflow.pipelines.pipeline import Pipeline
>   File "/opt/conda/miniconda3/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/pipelines/pipeline.py", line 194, in <module>
>     from mlflow.pipelines.regression.v1.pipeline import RegressionPipeline
>   File "/opt/conda/miniconda3/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/pipelines/regression/v1/__init__.py", line 1, in <module>
>     from mlflow.pipelines.regression.v1.pipeline import (
>   File "/opt/conda/miniconda3/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/pipelines/regression/v1/pipeline.py", line 116, in <module>
>     from mlflow.pipelines.steps.train import TrainStep
>   File "/opt/conda/miniconda3/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/pipelines/steps/train.py", line 34, in <module>
>     from mlflow.utils.mlflow_tags import (
> ImportError: cannot import name 'MLFLOW_PIPELINE_PROFILE_NAME' from 'mlflow.utils.mlflow_tags' (/opt/conda/miniconda3/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/utils/mlflow_tags.py)

I am using python 3.7 but then I saw changes in latest release so I thought python version is the issue, then i tried with 3.8 but still getting same error.
I faced the similar type of issue earlier also(when I am not taking latest pull then the docker file if it is changed or any import is removed then getting some error) after previous release. Is it mandatory to take latest pull even if I am maintaining old version? and if not then which part of code is still pointing to the MLflow git repository? 
@dbczumar  Can you please help? It's been more than 2 weeks I am blocked because of this.



### Other info / logs

_No response_
